CatDescriptText: Related article published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, National Edition, August 1, 1942, pg. 9, portions read: "Helen was the first to take the 'leap' Friday evening. As you know, she is the daughter of Mr. and Mrs. George Douglass of Oberlin Street...Brown-eyed and light haired and built on doll-like proportions so coveted by her handsome hubby, Frank Bolden, son of Mr. and Mrs. Frank Bolden Sr., of Washington, Pa., who is also a...these parts with a stack of college degrees and...stood before an embankment of ferns and palms...living room of the family residence.  She was lovely...white crepe two-piece dress with hat and...corsage of white rose buds.  Her wedding band...old-fashioned wide type.  Geraldine Taylor stood...Gerry wore a flesh outfit similar in design to the ...She wore a corsage of pink roses and accessories...same shade.  Helen was given in marriage by her...the Rev. Robert P. Johnson of Bethesda Presbyterian Church performed the ceremony..."
TitMainTitle: Bride Helen Douglass Bolden wearing white crepe suit, and corsage of rose buds, and groom Frank Bolden, standing in front of ferns and palms in living room, for Douglass - Bolden wedding
